result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elaine D Karpinen

records.addlTxt: and returned.
Competency hearing on November 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/30/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ

$500 posted to apply.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of Troy Dr in Madison.

Court reporter Trisch Clark. Defendant Elaine D Karpinen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen in court for Elaine D Karpinen.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a competency hearing regarding the DE not complying with order for competency evaluation. Court will order bail as follows. 

21CM2263- Raise cash bail in case 21CM2263 to $500.00, addition to the $500.00 already posted, for a total of $1,000.00. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CM984-Cash bail in the amount of $1000. $500.00 posted to apply. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

Court will reorder competency exam.
from K Jackson PsyD regarding defendants non appearance

Court reporter Teri Groves. Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen appears by telephone. Defendant Elaine D Karpinen appears in person, Attorney Collen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Ms. Karpinen answers questions of the court regarding her non compliance with the competency evaluation order. Atty Vander Meulen gives statement. State gives statement. Court makes findings and instructs DE to call Dr. Jackson immediately after hearing. If the evaluation is delayed because of DE the court will take DE in custody and do in-patient evaluation.
Defendant appeared late, warrant not issued

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Elaine D Karpinen not in court.  Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen in court for Elaine D Karpinen.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in place of Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for hearing in regards to defendant not complying with court ordered competency evaluation. State recommends bench warrant and in patient evaluation. Defense does not object. Court grants request for body only bench warrant in all four cases (21CM2263, 22CM984, 22CM1443, 22CM1626).
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
form WFU regarding non contact with the DE
Competency hearing has been moved from 9/29 to 9/30 at 9:00 am.
Competency hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program. Copy of minutes from AJH Hrg on 8/16/22 sent electronically to DCJ

Court reporter Meredith Seymour. Defendant Elaine D Karpinen in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen in court for Elaine D Karpinen.  Attorney Benjamin Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vander Meulen raises competency for her client. State does not object. Court to order a competency exam of the DE.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Court Lynn Schultz. Defendant did not appear.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE did not appear or contact the court. Court to issue a $500.00 cash bench warrant.
Parties have reached an agreement in both open cases and request plea/sentencing dates.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Zoom
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of Troy Dr in Madison. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

04:15 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.
